info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:16PM EDT until April 29 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... South Fork Catawba River at Lowell affecting Gaston County. .Persistent rounds of moderate to heavy rain late Thursday into early Friday morning resulted in 2-3 inches of rainfall across the entire South Fork Catawba River watershed. This rainfall resulted in significant rises along the river, culminating in Minor flooding in Cramerton. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River At Lowell. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS... At 10.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. South Fork Catawba River floodwaters are beginning to inundate Goat Island Park. More significant inundation is beginning to occur at Riverside Park. Floodwaters are approaching Riverside Dr near 5th and 6th Streets in Cramerton. At 9.0 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. South Fork Catawba River floodwaters begin to enter Riverside Park in Cramerton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 10.1 feet and falling steadily. - The South Fork Catawba River crested at 10.69 feet at 9:15 am Friday morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below Minor Flood Stage around midnight and fall below Action/Advisory Stage by late Saturday morning. - Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. Action/Advisory Stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
